pros: Great Benefits - insurance and paid time off.
cons: Not much room for advancement.

review_title: Great benefits but little room for those that want to grow in their careers.
pros: Great team. Independence. No micromanaging. Educational stipend and great insurance.
cons: No definite office space makes it hard to do your best work. Waste a lot of time trying to convince schools to let you have a space to work or use their copier/printer. I ended up doing most the work at night when I have access to everything I needed. Little room to grow.

pros: Health care benefits and 3 day work week in summer.
cons: Horrible place to work. HR office extremely unorganized. No procedure. No follow through. Department leaders are a joke. Executive Teams worries more about pronouns than making decision to grow the company. HUGE waste of tax payer dollars. The money funneled through this place is ridiculous. Most of it Squandered.

cons: Horrible school placement with no way out.

pros:
Supportive environment
No micromanaging
Satisfying feeling knowing the work you do is benefiting children

pros: One of the best-known providers of education and itinerant school-based staff in the area
cons:
- management is unapproachable and often condescending
- 60-75 hours of work expected in a 40 hour week w/o overtime pay
- caseloads of 3-4 times the state suggested limit makes provision of quality services extremely difficult
- staff is provided with almost no training and management support extremely limited, even for new grads

review_title: they have their perks and downfalls
job_title: Early Learning Consultant in Homestead, PA
pros:
Benefits. Medical Benefits are amazing. I pay $0 for my self and only $50 per month for my entire family. Most of the time we have $0 co-pays. 

 As an Early learning consultant I get summers off paid.
cons: Too many hands in the pot. Different rules for different departments under the same umbrella, Union isn't the best, and pay isn't very good. (although benefits kind of counteract that con)

pros: Flex schedule in the summer, love the director of my program
cons: Low pay, a lot of responsibilities

review_title: Great people to work for/ with!
pros: All of the supervisors are amazing, helpful, kind, caring and supportive.
cons: The pay could be a little better.

pros: The benefits are very good.
cons: The location is not very good.

pros: Great hours and PTO. Wonderful opportunity and able to move around.
cons: Union leads a lot of decision making

review_title: Great Employer, Compensation is Lacking, Benefits are top of the line
